docs.lead_paragraph: Americans see the economy improving, but doubts about their own financial circumstances may help Mitt Romney’s campaign, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

headline.seo: New York Times/CBS News Poll Shows Doubts on Economy Helping Romney
headline.main: In Wariness on Economy, Poll Finds Opening for Romney
headline.print_headline: Economic Doubts Offer an Opening to Romney Camp

docs.abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds a rising number of Americans see improvement in the economy, but a persistent wariness about their own financial circumstances is allowing presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney to persuade voters that he could improve their economic prospects more than Pres Obama; poll finds the two men are locked in a tight race, with each gathering 46 percent of the support.
docs.snippet: Americans see the economy improving, but doubts about their own financial circumstances may help Mitt Romney’s campaign, according to the latest New York Times/CBS News poll.

byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman and Marina Stefan contributed reporting.
byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and ALLISON KOPICKI

docs.lead_paragraph: The Leadership Conference of Women Religious has “serious doctrinal problems,” the church said as it appointed an American bishop to rein the group in.

headline.main: Vatican Reprimands a Group of U.S. Nuns and Plans Changes
headline.print_headline: Vatican Reprimands a Group Of U.S. Nuns and Plans Changes

docs.abstract: Vatican appoints an American bishop to rein in the Leadership Conference of Women Religious, the nation's most influential group of Catholic nuns; church claims the group has 'serious doctrinal problems' that include challenges to church doctrine on homosexuality and the male priesthood, as well as the promotion of feminist ideals.
docs.snippet: The Leadership Conference of Women Religious has “serious doctrinal problems,” the church said as it appointed an American bishop to rein the group in.

docs.lead_paragraph: Six mannequin torsos -- three wearing Chicago Bulls jerseys and three with Boston Celtics jerseys -- sat on tables in front of N.B.A. owners in a meeting room at the St. Regis hotel in Manhattan. The jerseys were unlike any that the Bulls and the Celtics wear. All had a corporate name or logo -- and were sartorial harbingers of the N.B.A.'s future.
docs.abstract: Presentation to the NBA's board of governors suggest that the league might become the first of the four established leagues in the United States to allow its players to wear advertising. (M)

docs.abstract: For the first time since three female Supreme Court justices have been sitting together, the court considered a sex discrimination claim. They ended up on the losing side.
docs.snippet: For the first time since three female Supreme Court justices have been sitting together, the court considered a sex discrimination claim. They ended up on the losing side.

docs.abstract: Eliminating the deductions for mortgage interest on vacation homes and for state and local taxes would make only a minor dent in future deficits.

headline.main: Income of Rulers vs. the Ruled

docs.abstract: Is today's socioeconomic gap between American politicians and their constituents really unusually wide? A look at inequality between leaders and those they lead, from Rome to the present.
docs.snippet: Is today's socioeconomic gap between American politicians and their constituents really unusually wide? A look at inequality between leaders and those they lead, from Rome to the present.

docs.abstract: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.
docs.snippet: A summary of what's on today's editorial page.

docs.abstract: To effect change in how the nation tackles its deficit and overhauls its tax code, we need leaders willing to take on the powerful lobbies of interest groups and industries, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: To effect change in how the nation tackles its deficit and overhauls its tax code, we need leaders willing to take on the powerful lobbies of interest groups and industries, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo wisely issued an executive order to establish a health insurance exchange after state lawmakers failed to do so.
docs.abstract: Editorial applauds New York Gov Andrew Cuomo for issuing an executive order that establishes a state health insurance exchange after state's Republican-led Senate refused to do so.
docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo wisely issued an executive order to establish a health insurance exchange after state lawmakers failed to do so.

docs.lead_paragraph: lottery winner was charged with fraud on Tuesday for collecting food stamps and public health insurance despite pocketing a $735,000 jackpot on a game show, “Make Me Rich!”

headline.print_headline: Michigan: Lottery Winner Charged In Fraud

docs.snippet: lottery winner was charged with fraud on Tuesday for collecting food stamps and public health insurance despite pocketing a $735,000 jackpot on a game show, “Make Me Rich!”
